posts.name: Baltimore Farmers' Market and Bazaar
posts.add1: E Saratoga St and Holliday St
posts.note: While strolling through Maryland's largest producers-only market (producers-only meaning all vendors make what they sell), shoppers can revel at the sight of a vast quantity of foods, including crisp seasonal fruits and vegetables, poultry, seafood, beef, pork, lamb, rabbit, fresh baked goods, flavorful herbs, and organically raised and produced milk, yogurt, butter, eggs and cheese products. Additionally, dozens of food vendors add spice to the market with multi-cultural cuisines. These include traditional pit beef sandwiches, omelets, breakfast burritos, crepes, wood-fired pizzas, pies and quiches, soups, noodles, and dumplings. If you like fresh horseradish, you need to find the guy selling turkey burgers near the information booth. His horseradish will clean out your sinuses. It's that strong.

posts.name: Bar Clavel
posts.note: Bar Clavel serves Mexican-inspired cocktails, and elevated cuisine is served in a simple room with hip hanging lights. From the DC Eater website, 'Bar Clavel serves Mexican-inspired cocktails, and elevated cuisine is served in a simple room with hip hanging lights. Clavel’s build-your-own taco kits ensure the beans and barbacoa don’t weigh down the tortillas before you get them home. The popular Remington spot reopened outdoor dining at the restaurant and continues to offer takeout.'

posts.name: Bertha's Mussels
posts.note: Bertha's Mussels has been a quirky seafood joint and tavern since 1972, known for mussels and regularly scheduled live music. From the Baltimore Magazine website, 'At this funky 43-year-old Fells Point landmark, expectant locals and tourists alike arrive in droves for black-shelled bivalves. Mussels come hot and tender, with an array of marvelous melted butter's, including garlic, spinach, and tarragon, or anchovy-tomato, but we strongly suggest one of the specials submerged in coconut milk and Thai chili or chorizo and Heavy Seas beer. For more succulent shelled snacks, consider the escargot, or keep it classic with steamed shrimp. And on your way out, don’t forget to grab the famous “Eat Bertha’s Mussels” bumper sticker (said to have been sighted on all seven continents) to help spread their gospel of goodness.'

posts.name: Black Hog BBQ Bar
posts.note: Black Hog BBQ Bar is a local chain offering Carolina and Arkansas-style 'cue, with ribs, wings, sides, and drinks. You need to order the Carolina Chopped smoked pork shoulder with vinegar sauce or the Arkansas Brisket which double smoked, rough cut, smoked again with some sweet and smoky sauce. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Blue Agave
posts.note: Blue Agave is a festive Mexican eatery and tequila bar (more than 130 labels) with classic ceramic-tiled tabletops. If you're starving or have a large group, order the four-pound burrito with chicken and skirt steak. From their website, 'An experience at Blue Agave isn’t just about placing an order or starting a tab. It’s about experiencing more—more quality, more variety, more excitement, more TLC. We start with fresh sauces, salsas, and moles made in-house daily. We continue with over 130 tequilas, masterfully crafted cocktails, and a staff of kind (unless messed with), fun (sorry about that hangover), and knowledgeable (but never boring) people. And we don’t stop until you’ve gotten everything you came in for, and then some.'

posts.name: Blue Moon Cafe
posts.note: Blue Moon Cafe is a popular cafe is serving American breakfast meals in a bright, funky setting, open 24 hours on weekends. The dish to get is the Captain Crunch French Toast with homemade whip cream and fresh seasonal berries. Their cheese omelette, home fries, and toast is great too. If you're still hungry, see if you can get yourself one of their enormous cinnamon rolls? From their website, 'Baltimore-based Conceptionista Sarah Simington has traveled the country honing her craft. In 1996 Sarah, and her mother Sherri- a diner veteran, opened acclaimed The Blue Moon Cafe in the historic Fells Point area of Baltimore, Maryland. Sarah's personal style is in every corner of The Blue Moon Cafe. From the bright and funky artwork to the music, you know Sarah's rock and roll attitude goes into every bite of her food. Driven by the passion she has for mixing people and food, Sarah strives for every bite to invoke discovery and playfulness for anyone that tackles her signature breakfast. Adventurous as they may be, Blue Moon diners agree that you don't have to be a kid to get excited about diving into her now-famous Captain Crunch French Toast. Sarah's love of food as a means of a personal connection comes from watching her mother serve up some of the country's best diner food. Sarah's classic diner exposure gave her a love for breakfast food, which is, as everyone knows, the most important meal of the day!' NOTE: They have a second location called Blue Moon Too in the Federal Hill area of Baltimore.

posts.name: Bob's Shanghai 66
posts.note: Bob's Shanghai 66 is a no-frills strip-mall establishment serving regional Chinese entrees, noodle soups, and dim sum. From their website, 'Bob's Shanghai was founded in Rockville, Maryland in 2013. We have been awarded recognition by the Washingtonian Restaurant Guide, the Washington Post, Yelp, and Zagat Survey. Our menu favorites have been the Pork XLB (soup dumplings) and the crab pork dumplings. Other special dishes include Spicy Szechuan Style Sliced Beef, Salt and Pepper Crispy Jumbo shrimp, Spicy Pork Wontons.'
posts.rcmmnd: Best Chinese restaurant in every state from MSN website

posts.name: Brewer's Alley
posts.note: Brewer's Alley is a kid friendly and invites you to visit and enjoy the house beers at their distinctive bar as well as some of the Finest Culinary Creations in one of their beautiful dining rooms. In the heart of Historic Frederick, Maryland, Brewer's Alley has become a favorite destination for residents and worldwide travelers alike.

posts.name: Bruster's
posts.note: Bruster's has counter-serve chain where all of the ice cream selections are made fresh on-site every day. If you like salted caramel ice cream, you need to order their sea salt caramel ice cream. If you like dark chocolate from what I could see you need to get Bruster's death by chocolate. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: The Bun Shop
posts.note: The Bun Shop is a loft-like, late-night cafe for filled buns like piroshki and empanadas, plus Vietnamese coffee. BYOB. From the Baltimore Magazine website, 'The Bun Shop: This artsy Mt. Vernon cafe, known for its wide array of sweet and savory pastries, is expected to launch its second location at the end of November. The new Inner Harbor spot will feature an expanded kitchen and offer The Bun Shop’s signature tarts, puffs, empanadas, donuts, coffees, and teas.'

posts.name: Bushwaller's
posts.note: Bushwaller’s prides themselves on serving fresh, house-made cuisine in the warmth and comfort of an Irish Pub. For over 30 years, Bushwaller’s has been one of downtown Frederick’s most popular restaurants. They specialize in serving savory Irish and American comfort dishes such as Fish ‘n Chips, Shepherd’s Pie, Bangers ‘n Mash, Guinness Beef Stew, and Burgers. Bushwaller’s likes to think of themselves as the community living room, so they strive to create a casual, inviting, flavorful dining experience at affordable prices Great, quite a local bar to relax, talk, eat, and drink or at least the day we were there.

posts.name: Caribbean Palace Restaurant
posts.note: Caribbean Palace Restaurant is a pint-size Caribbean take-out counter offering generous servings of roti, jerk chicken, and curry.

posts.name: Chaps Pit Beef
posts.note: Chaps Pit Beef is a popular pit-beef outlet that serves their namesake sandwiches and homestyle sides in a strip-club parking lot. You need to order the 'Habbit,' which has smoked roast beef, smoked turkey, and smoked ham, along with cheese and a side of French fries. From their website, 'Chaps Pit Beef proudly serves Maryland’s best pit beef, turkey, and pork as well as BBQ chicken and ribs. We pair those items with delicious home-style sides, including hand-cut fries, baked beans, green beans, coleslaw, potato salad, and more!' NOTE: They have multiple locations in the Maryland area.
posts.cptn: Cross section of the 'Habbit', which has smoked roast beef, smoked turkey and smoked ham, along with cheese and a side of French fries

posts.name: The Charmery
posts.note: TThe Charmery is a quirky, family-owned ice cream shop is offering innovative and seasonal flavors in a cheery space. From their website, 'We use the best possible ingredients, supporting local farmers and producers whenever possible. Featuring ever-changing seasonal ice cream flavors, specialty sundaes, hand-spun milkshakes, and floats. The Charmery loves to collaborate with our local community, including artists, musicians, and community figures.' NOTE - They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Chick and Ruth's
posts.note: Chick and Ruth's is a lively landmark diner is featuring greasy-spoon breakfasts and piled-high sandwiches in kitschy environs. You need to try their breakfast items or one of their other meals named after famous people.

posts.name: Crab Deck
posts.note: The Crab Deck is a full service, waterfront dining, inside and outside on the Kent Narrows with lunch, dinner, happy hour, kids menu, and steamed crabs. When I'm here, I get an order of steamed shrimp, three or four of their largest crabs, and a side of corn on the cob, so I at least ate one vegetable.

posts.name: Davis's Pub
posts.note: Davis's Pub is a long-running (since the 1920s) neighborhood joint known for its crab cakes and creative pub fare.

posts.name: Double T Diner
posts.note: Double T Diner is a Local diner chain with a retro vibe and a menu of comfort-food classics (some are open 24 hours). You need to try some of their great desserts along with the substantial breakfasts. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Gary’s Grilled Turkey Burgers & Sauces
posts.add1: E Saratoga St and Holliday St
posts.note: Gary's Grilled Turkey Burgers and Sauces have an Apple Chipotle is available every week. They rotate the Thai Chili, Mango Habanero, and Ginger Teriyaki burgers so that one of them is also available weekly. I haven't yet had one of Gary's burgers, but the thing I go to his stand for is his horseradish which is really strong and can clean out your head. He also sells horseradish mustard in a larger size than the small horseradish jar.

posts.name: Golden West Cafe
posts.note: Golden West Cafe is a funky Hampden road-house is offering New Mexican dishes and eclectic comfort grub in unpretentious digs. The one item that has never steered me wrong is the Huevos Montulenos, which is whole kernel corn cakes topped with two sunny-up eggs, pinto -or- black beans, green -or- red chile sauce, feta cheese, salsa Fresca, fried banana, and a flour tortilla. From the Food Network website, 'A breakfast worthy of champions and worthy of Duff, the Huevos Montulenos at Golden West Cafe satisfy any hungry eater with their kernel corn cakes, tasty pinto beans, and fried banana. Along with New Mexican specialties, you can also order Maine blueberry pancakes and a vegan BBQ sandwich. They recommend you order the Huevos Montelenos, which I had before I knew on the recommendation of the waitperson that took our order if I never came back.'

posts.name: Grano Pasta Bar
posts.note: Grano Pasta Bar is a small, homey pick for hearty Italian noodles and sauces with indoor/outdoor seating, It's BYOB (bring your own beer). You should order any of the fresh pasta dishes, especially seafood, since Baltimore is so close to the ocean. From their website, 'Traditional old world pasta recipes and trendy global discoveries of new flavors and technics. Always respecting the work and efforts of our food suppliers.'

posts.name: Jimmy's Famous Seafood
posts.note: If Jimmy's Famous Seafood deserves fame, for one thing, it’s the crab cakes which is 95 percent crab, 5 percent binding. The crab cakes — which are about the size of your hand — are packed with fresh Maryland lump blue-crab meat. Another massive menu item is the Seafood UFO. The oversized slices of bread that hold this sandwich together can barely contain all the fillings: colossal crab cakes and crab-studded mac and cheese balls, along with mounds of fried shrimp, fried oysters, and shrimp salad.

posts.name: Joe Squared
posts.note: Joe Squared serves a long list of unusual pizzas and risottos. From what I've read, they have daily live music along with art shows in a laid-back atmosphere. A quote from their website 'Joe Squared is a family-owned, Baltimore-bred restaurant and bar for people who love food, drink, music, art, and community located in the Station North Arts and Entertainment District. Our unique coal-fired sourdough crusted pizza has been named one of the best in America. We also offer catering, a private party room, take-out, and delivery.' From the Baltimore Sun website, 'Joe Squared sells slices only on Fridays and Saturdays from 9 p.m. to 2 a.m. Most people are used to eating slices on weeknights and at lunch, and if forced to eat an entire 10-inch pizza, which can feed two easily, they might be less inclined to try it. To keep things simple, we tried only 10-inch pizzas. Joe Squared serves other fare such as risotto, sandwiches, salads, and appetizers — but most people come for the pizza.'

posts.name: Kuya Ja's Lechon Belly
posts.note: From the Kuya Ja's Lechon Belly website, 'If you ask the locals for the most mouthwatering dish, they will always tell you it’s their Lechon. What exactly is Lechon? It is an entire pig roasted over charcoal rotisserie style. Kuya Ja’s Lechon Belly specializes in roasting boneless pork belly. From its crispy skin to its juicy meat, Kuya Ja’s is here to provide for you the best Cebuano style Lechon experience. We take pride in every Lechon belly we serve.  Our Lechon belly will take you on a journey across the world with each bite; it’s our guarantee!  Our chef/owner Javier J. Fernandez (aka Ja), treats each Lechon with the care and love that it deserves.  His passion is Filipino food, and his goal is to influence your palate though the celebration of real Pinoy food and flavors. Chef Ja was born on the island of Cebu, known as the “second city” after Manila. Cebu is famous for having the best Lechon's in the world. He has traveled all over Cebu to refine his techniques to create his very own boneless Lechon belly masterpiece! He takes immense pleasure in preparing every single belly as if he were serving it for his family.'

posts.name: Le Comptoir du Vin
posts.note: From the Baltimore Magazine website about Le Comptoir du Vin, 'A restaurant’s menu can be minimalist without being simple. Proof of this can be found in Station North, where the charming new European-style bistro Le Comptoir du Vin has been impressing sophisticated diners since it opened in November. Generally, just seven to 10 dishes are scrawled in white chalk on a blackboard in the tiny dining room, but each of them offers a gateway to the best attributes of French-inspired cuisine.'

posts.name: Lexington Market
posts.note: Lexington Market is an enormous indoor market established in 1782, with food stands and produce, meat and seafood purveyors. From their website, 'Lexington Market is a taste of Baltimore you can’t find anywhere else. It’s local people making local food, incorporating local favorites with flavors from all around the world. It’s diverse, it’s unique, it’s Baltimore. Baltimore’s Lexington Market is the oldest market in America. Founded in 1782 at the site where it stands today, Lexington has served Baltimore and surrounding communities for more than nine generations. It’s as old as America itself.'

posts.name: Maggie's Farm
posts.note: Maggie's Farm is an intimate bar and restaurant showcasing thoughtfully sourced, globally inspired provisions and cocktails. From their website, 'is committed to supporting local farms, businesses, and charities. We currently source from Kohl Family Farm,  TUSCARORA ORGANIC CO-OP, Andy's Eggs and Poultry, Roseda Farms, Zeke's coffee, our garden, and more. We strive to provide quality service and product in a comfortable space. We might not be the best. But we hope we're your favorite.'

posts.name: Mandalay Restaurant and Cafe
posts.note: Mandalay Restaurant and Cafe is a simple, family-run eatery serves spicy Burmese menu with vegetarian and vegan options, plus a full bar. Mandalay Restaurant and Café brings dishes from all over Burma to the Washington, DC area. They do not specialize in the cuisine of any particular area of Burma (Myanmar). Instead, they bring a mix of dishes from the seasides to the mountains, using fresh ingredients and time tested recipes.

posts.name: Mansa Kunda Restaurant
posts.note: From the Mansa Kunda Restaurant website, 'Mansa Kunda is bringing West African food to Takoma Park, MD. Almost 90% of our dishes can be made vegetarian. Our owner is a practicing vegetarian and can accommodate most requests for vegetarian dishes. We are working on a new menu, which will clearly indicate which items are vegetarian and/or gluten-free.'

posts.name: Miss Shirley’s Cafe
posts.note: Miss Shirley’s Cafe is a brunch cafe boasting local ingredients, and they have outdoor seating plus a pancake-of-the-month special. From their website, 'Miss Shirley's Cafe offers guests an upscale-casual and exceptional award-winning culinary experience for all-day breakfast, brunch and lunch. Our specialties are rooted in Southern fundamentals and the abundance of fresh ingredients from Maryland. We pride ourselves in beautifully presented plates, prompt and professional service, as well as clean, comfortable and well-maintained premises for our guests.' NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: The Mushroom Stand
posts.add1: E Saratoga St and Holliday St
posts.note: When you're at The Mushroom Stand, you need to order the King Oyster Mushroom Fritters with fresh feta and some hot sauce with salad greens. They were worth the wait. They only sell 200 orders, and when they're gone, they're gone. Their grilled/roasted portabella mushroom sandwich or salad looked great too while waiting for my food.

posts.name: One-Eyed Mike's
posts.note: One-Eyed Mike’s is a local gastropub is located in a historic former tavern with a hand-carved bar, tin ceiling, and courtyard. If they have cioppino, a seafood stew, you need to order it if it's on special. From their website, ‘Part of the old school charm of One-Eyed Mike’s is that it’s not located among the other taverns and restaurants in the heart of Fell’s Point. It stands alone, located just off the beaten path on a cozy block of Bond St. It’s a place where the locals frequent and refers to as their own. At One-Eyed Mike’s, we’ve created an atmosphere where “you’re a stranger here but once.”’

posts.name: Sip and Bite Restaurant
posts.note: Sip and Bite has been a local landmark since 1948 and is known for its crab cakes, and diner fare served seven days a week, along with their beer and wine selection. From their website, 'Sip & Bite is most famous for crabcakes and serving hearty breakfasts all day and night at prices that keep our guests and friends coming back for more. Whether it is for breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks with Happy Hour prices all day, or the amazing Crab Cakes, the portions are always fresh and plentiful. For over 70 years, we have made our crab cakes with the same tried-and-true recipe which includes quality crabmeat, just the right spices and our legendary technique in preparation.'

posts.name: The Smoking Swine
posts.note: The Smoking Swine is a traveling food truck. Make sure if you have the chance to get the beef rib and the pulled pork sandwich. From their website, 'We are driven by a desire to make the best Traditional American BBQ that you have ever had, provide customer service that has no equal, and to be held as the standard by which you judge all other BBQ joints.' From the Food Network website, 'Loyal fans line up at Drew Pumphrey’s mobile food truck to get their fill of his smoked specialties like short ribs and pulled pork sandwiches. A favorite sandwich is The Carolina: Boneless pork butt is hit with a brown sugar dry rub, smoked for 12 hours, then doused with a spicy barbecue sauce that has Guy Fieri hooked. A topping of homemade slaw laced with chipotle powder adds a kick to the bite. Guy recommends The Carolina and the Beef Short Rib.' NOTE: Visit their Facebook page for their weekly schedule.
posts.hrs: Closed Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday

posts.name: Storm Brothers Ice Cream Factory
posts.note: Storm Brothers Ice Cream Factory is a neighborhood ice cream parlor serving cones, shakes, flurries, sundaes and more since 1976. They have over 40 flavors so you should be able to find something you want to eat.

posts.name: Taharka Brothers Ice Cream
posts.note: Taharka Brothers Ice Cream products can be found at restaurants, shops, and their seasonal food truck, which can be spotted at area events. People especially like the pistachio, salty caramel, and butter-pecan ice cream. Still, they love the company’s creativity with other flavors, of which you should order the roasted strawberry or the vanilla fudge mint. From their website, ‘Well known for serving up classic flavors along with a constantly evolving roster of delightful, small-batch flavors beloved in Baltimore, Taharka Brothers’ award-winning ice cream lineup includes favorites like Honey Graham, Mintflix and Chillz, Key Lime Pie, and Caramel Crunch. Taharka Brothers are widely known for our unique social mission, focused on creating an impactful, profitable business managed and operated by young adults from some of Baltimore’s most troubled neighborhoods. Our menu features rotating seasonal and one-time flavors inspired by local happenings and a handful of “collaborations’’ with other local small businesses throughout the year!’

posts.name: Tastee Diner
posts.note: Tastee Diner is a longtime old-school diner serving home-style American comfort-food classics 24 hours, 7 days a week. I have mostly been here for dessert and maybe a breakfast or two over the years. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Thai Tanium Restaurant
posts.note: Thai Tanium Restaurant serves Thai specialties, has a full bar and lunch deals in a glossy space at Kentlands Market Square. You need to order the Larb Gai (minced chicken with a spicy lime sauce) along with the Pad Mee chicken (Drunken noodles) and the Thai Tanium Star which is shrimp with minced chicken, watercress, veggies, and a Thai shrimp cake.

posts.name: The Uncaged Chefs
posts.note: From their website, 'The Uncaged Chefs are always innovating, creating unusual but delicious dishes some have never seen before. Common combinations of flavors and traditional cuisine are at the opposite end of all that this work represents. These chefs live to create unforgettable and never-seen-before dishes. The Uncaged Chefs are actively helping and motivating aspiring chefs in Washington. The fact that many in this group went from being unknown in the world to some of the most renowned chefs in the most popular city in the US is not by accident. The secret to their success lies in dedication, skill, and boldness.'

posts.name: Woodberry Kitchen
posts.note: Woodberry Kitchen is an old factory turned hip, a rustic-chic place for refined New American fare with a farm-to-table bent.
posts.hrs: Closed Saturday, Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday

posts.name: Zoe's Chocolate Co.
posts.note: Zoe’s Chocolate combines the tradition of past generations and true artisan chocolatiers, with the modern sophistication of today’s flavors, trends, and ingredients. You need to buy yourself a roasted almond and dark chocolate bar.
